And while not every formula we test is a winner, we're constantly unearthing new favorites. Here, we've rounded up our latest hair, skin, fragrance, wellness and makeup discoveries — whether fresh-to-market drops or merely recent additions to our personal routines.Between fashion month's avant-garde makeup looks and the awards circuit's signature Hollywood glam, we've been mentally saving a lot of beauty inspo this February while upgrading our cosmetics bags in the process.For our standout makeup discoveries, we couldn't get enough of a creamy, hydrating lip liner with its own built-in blending tool, a gel-like coral cheek tint, a full-coverage foundation boasting a skin-like finish and a glossy tinted lip balm delivering a pigmented, plumping finish. We also updated our skin-care routines with a foaming gel cleanser that breaks down waterproof mascara, snail mucin-infused face masks and an azelaic acid-spiked calming serum. And with the lingering cold weather stealing moisture from our skin, team Fashionista reached for hydrating body-care saviors like an ultra-moisturizing body milk, a summery-scented body butter and a magnesium-rich pain-relief cream.Scroll to ContinueRecommended ArticlesAhead, see (and shop!) all of our favorite beauty finds from February.Shani Darden Rescue Serum, $68, available here: "Shani Darden is one of the skin-care brands I trust the most: If the celebrity esthetician-founder releases a new product, I can reasonably expect that my (mid-30s, acne- and hyperpigmentation-prone) skin will, at a minimum, respond well, and likely also see real results. The brand's new multi-purpose Rescue Serum (spiked with azelaic acid alongside soothing, anti-inflammatory and hydrating ingredients) is an example of the latter: I've literally seen it destroy pimples and redness overnight, and with continued use, it's helped to reduce texture, fade post-acne marks and calm my skin overall, to the point that it feels less acne-prone to begin with. It's officially a staple in my routine (and Steph's)." —Dhani Mau, Editor in ChiefRhode Peptide Lip Shape, $24, available here: "Rhode has done it again with these creamy, super blendable liners. They glide on smoothly, diffuse and blend out beautifully and create a matte — but natural, not chalky — finish. They're also spiked with peptides for hydration and smoothness and feature a genius clean up/blending tool on the other end. My favorite shades are Press, a rosebud pink; and Bend, a beige-y light brown." —Steph Saltzman, Beauty + Style DirectorMedik8 Liquid Peptides Advanced Face Serum, $92, available here: "This lightweight, gel-like serum absorbs quickly, making it an easy first step in my nightly routine. It's spiked with peptides that penetrate skin deeply, and according to the brand, it's 'clinically proven to diminish the appearance of expression lines in 10 minutes.' That's a super bold claim I'm not sure I can attest to, but with regular use, I do think it's softened some of my emerging fine lines. Plus, it doesn't pill when layered beneath other products." —Savannah Sitton, Market + Branded Content Editor Coola Firming Face Oil Face Sunscreen SPF 30, $48, available here: "I've loved using this face oil on extra dry winter days when my skin needs to lock in some extra hydration. In addition to offering sun protection, it's also laced with antioxidants and supposedly shields against the blue light emitted from screens. In other words, it's an overachieving, one-step multitasker — perfect for busy mornings." —Brooke Frischer, Staff Writer + Social Media ManagerBeekman 1802 Cleansing Gel and Makeup Remover, $29, available here: "This two-in-one cleanser and makeup remover is a chef's kiss formula for melting away all traces of makeup — even my waterproof mascara — within seconds, without drying, stripping or irritating my skin. It only takes a small dab to lather into a soothing foam; I massage it in and then wipe it away with a microfiber cloth for a fully cleansed complexion." —Janelle Sessoms, Staff WriterLys Beauty Speak Love Lip-Plumping Glossy Lip Balm in Visionary, $19, available here: "This gloss-balm hybrid effortlessly glides onto lips, ensuring a hydrated, fuller-looking finish without the tingling sensation associated with other plumping balms. It's formulated with chia seed oil and hyaluronic acid for moisture and hydration, as well as a fruit-and-veggie blend for vitamins and antioxidants. Basically, it's a smoothie for your lips. Molded into Lys Beauty's signature triangular packaging, the glossy lip balm in the shade Visionary (a delicious cinnamon brown) has quickly become a must-have in my lip-care stash." —Catie Pusateri, Contributing WriterAmika Superfruit Star Lightweight Hair Styling Oil, $32, available here: "Anytime I use an oil on my fine-yet-dry-and-frizzy 3a/b curly hair, it's with extreme caution and a little fear: Just a tad too much product and my hair and ends up looking flat and greasy, so I immediately jumped at the chance to try a new one with the word 'lightweight' right there in the name. I can fearlessly use a pump or two to add much-needed hydration and shine to damp or dry hair. Plus, it doubles as a heat protector in the event I decide to do a blowout — and it smells great." —DhaniSisley Paris Sensitive Skin Soothing Care, $240, available here: "I have both acne-prone and reactive skin, and this lightweight cream has been a winter complexion savior. It's helped soothe redness and irritation without exacerbating breakouts. Packed with rapeseed and plum kernel oil, it's moisturizing, restorative and coddling in all the right ways." —StephMake Beauty Heat Stroke Dewy Gel Cheek Tint, $30, available here: "I'm not typically a blush girl, but I was pleasantly surprised by how simple to use these little sticks are. The solid bullet glides on like a gel, imparting a pretty tint and a subtle dewy finish that's not at all sticky. As a blush novice, I especially appreciate that it blends out and layers easily with a foundation brush, sponge or even my fingers. This coral pink shade made me look radiant — I even tapped some onto my nose, and it really enhanced my (fake) tan." —SavannahCosRX Advanced Snail Mucin Glass Glow Hydrogel Face Masks (Pack of 3), $15, available here: "I finally got around to trying CosRX's beloved Snail Mucin line, including this TikTok-viral overnight sheet mask. Spoiler alert: It's worth the hype. After wearing the snail-secretion-filtrate- and glycerin-packed treatment while I slept, I woke up with the glow-y glass skin you see in everyone's 'morning shed' videos. Plus, my skin felt smoother and softer than ever. I'll be purchasing many more of these." —BrookeFenty Beauty Butta Drop Hydrating Body Milk, $32, available here: "My skin is usually so dry and ashy in the winter, but this lightweight moisturizer has fixed that issue. Packed with coconut oil, shea butter and baobab oil, the silky, lightweight, fast-absorbing lotion softens and revives my thirsty skin without looking greasy. It's how my legs and arms survived fashion week whilst being exposed to the snow, rain, wind and sleet." —JanelleBeauty of Joseon Daily Tinted Fluid Sunscreen, $20, available here: "Korean skin-care brand Beauty of Joseon — whom you may know from its TikTok-viral SPF — has answered my sun-care prayers and released its first-ever mineral tinted sunscreen. With a featherlight fluid texture, the formula delivers a naturally radiant finish, sheer weightless coverage and a boost of hydration courtesy of olive lipids. Even though it's quite liquid-y, the SPF 40 tint (which is available in 12 shades) doesn't veer into greasy or eye-irritating territory, so much so that I forgot I was wearing it halfway through the day. As with any sun-care products, don't forget to first apply a base layer of SPF and reapply every two hours for continued coverage." —CatieNécessaire The Lip Balm, $25, available here: "There are a lot of good lip balms out there, to the point that new launches rarely feel worth calling out, but Nécessaire's is a new favorite. I'm truly impressed by how long one swipe can keep my lips feeling ultra-smooth and moisturized, reducing the need for reapplication; and with the hint of mint essential oil, it nearly doubles as a breath freshener. It also imparts a lovely glossy (but not too glossy) shine without any stickiness." —DhaniYSL Beauty Make Me Blush 24H Buildable Powder Blush in 93 Restless Rose, $45, available here: "Most powder blushes either go on too transparently or exacerbate texture on my skin — but this new formula from YSL is a complete game changer. It blurs and diffuses light, creating a glow-y, radiant finish; plus, it packs such a pigment punch that just the lightest swipe with a brush is all you need. I usually stay away from even a hint of shimmer in my blush, but with how ultra finely milled this one is, it just reads as luminous, not glittery." —StephIris & Romeo Skin Cocoon Barrier Glow Serum, $58, available here: "I use a lot of serums (it's like a game to see how many I can layer together successfully!) but this new one from Iris & Romeo feels unique. The formula has a viscous, almost oil-like texture that's surprisingly lightweight. I love that it leave my skin plump and glow-y; I've been using it as the final 'topper' serum in my lineup. I feel it really seals in all of the previous serums (for maximum impact) while providing a nice base for creams. All that sandwiching might sound extreme, but all that moisture has saved my winter skin." —SavannahLoveShackFancy x Goody Pink English Ivy Large Claw, $13, available here: "Ever since I purchased my first Wet Brush in middle school, I've considered the brand my go-to for detangling. So when the brand announced it was teaming up with Goody and LoveShackFancy for a collaboration, I couldn't wait to get my hands on one of the toile-patterned paddles and the adorable claw clips in LoveShackFancy's signature floral designs. I'm definitely going to be reaching for this accessory constantly once spring has fully sprung." —BrookePrada Beauty Infusion de Rhubarbe Eau de Parfum, $190, available here: "I typically reserve my floral-fruity scents for spring and summer, but this charming fragrance is fit to be worn year-round. It has an interesting citrusy — yet faintly spicy — scent profile, thanks to its notes of green mandarin, rhubarb, rose and white musk. It has an impressive staying power, too, lasting a good few hours after the initial spritz (but it's not so strong it gives me a headache)." —JanelleGlossier Ultralip High Shine Lipstick in Flute, $22, available here: "Glossier's Ultralip is quite the overachiever: It acts as a three-in-one lip balm, tint and gloss with a boost of hydration, buildable color and lightweight sheen. It's packed with hydrators like meadowfoam seed oil, watermelon seed oil, jojoba seed oil and hyaluronic acid, which leave my lips feeling ultra-smooth, moisturized and rejuvenated. I've been loving the shade Flute, a bright strawberry red, and diffusing the lipstick around the edges for a soft, dreamy finish." —CatieLawless Forget the Filler Foundation, $43, available here: "To find a full-coverage foundation that also creates a natural, skin-like finish is rare enough — but to find one that also feels weightless is even more unique. This formula does all that, and also creates a smooth base for the rest of your makeup. It's enhanced with skin-care ingredients like hyaluronic acid, vitamin E and glycerin for smoothness and moisture, and you can really tell with how it wears throughout the day." —StephTatcha The Brightening Serum, $89, available here: "In comparison to other vitamin C serums, I've found this brightening formula to be remarkably gentle — I've been using it all winter and never experienced any burning or irritation. The consistency is lightweight, almost like an essence (but slightly more gel-like than watery), and absorbs quickly, making it a really easy step in my morning and nightly routines for improving hyperpigmentation and dullness." —Savannah Merit x Completedworks The Compact, $38, available here: "On the heels of Merit's first-ever jewelry collaboration with London-based brand Completedworks, the duo linked up again to create a travel-friendly compact mirror. I'm guilty of using my iPhone camera (or any random reflective surface) as a mirror for touching up my lipstick, but this silver, molten jewelry-inspired compact has elevated my reapplication game. It's crafted to easily fit in the palm of your hand to assist in on-the-go refreshes, and its sleek design makes me feel like quite the grown-up." —CatieWholesome Hippy Calm Cream with Magnesium & Vitamin D3 Pain Blend, $32, available here: "I hit my fitness goals hard this month, which triggered some aches and pains — so I was glad to have this helpful magnesium-enhanced lotion on hand. The ingredient is whipped into a creamy blend of shea, cocoa and mango butter, along with arnica and vitamin D for pain-relieving and anti-inflammatory properties. It definitely helped to soothe my muscles and isn't too strongly scented (just a touch minty). For something spicer, though, the brand's Born To Be Wild Muscle Relief Gel has menthol for that icy-yet-hot feel." —SavannahSaltair Multi-Lipid Body Butter in Golden Hour, $20, available here: "February's frigid, dry weather has done a number on me, so I've been slathering on Saltair's new body butter to restore my dull, parched, sensitive skin. Formulated with skin barrier-boosting ingredients like a ceramides, phospholipids, fatty acids, phytosterols and sea buckthorn oil, the formula helped me finally feel smooth and hydrated. Plus, the creamy (but never greasy) butter smells like a sunny summer day, with refreshing notes of sunflower, pineapple and coconut." —CatieIn case you missed last month's picks, you can find them here:Please note: Occasionally, we use affiliate links on our site. Each month, Fashionista editors try a *lot* of beauty products. And while not every formula we test is a winner, we're constantly unearthing new favorites. Here, we've rounded up our latest hair, skin, fragrance, wellness and makeup discoveries — whether fresh-to-market drops or merely recent additions to our personal routines.

Between fashion month's avant-garde makeup looks and the awards circuit's signature Hollywood glam, we've been mentally saving a lot of beauty inspo this February while upgrading our cosmetics bags in the process.

For our standout makeup discoveries, we couldn't get enough of a creamy, hydrating lip liner with its own built-in blending tool, a gel-like coral cheek tint, a full-coverage foundation boasting a skin-like finish and a glossy tinted lip balm delivering a pigmented, plumping finish. 

We also updated our skin-care routines with a foaming gel cleanser that breaks down waterproof mascara, snail mucin-infused face masks and an azelaic acid-spiked calming serum. And with the lingering cold weather stealing moisture from our skin, team Fashionista reached for hydrating body-care saviors like an ultra-moisturizing body milk, a summery-scented body butter and a magnesium-rich pain-relief cream.
